arm_group.description: Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml.
Anterior scalp block with 0.9% normal saline 20 ml.

brief_summary.textblock:
Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml. may reduce the intraoperative opioid
      consumption in neurosurgical patients who undergoing the supratentorial craniotomy compared
      to those who receive 0.9% normal saline solution (placebo).

clinical_study.brief_title: Scalp Nerve Block and Opioid Consumption in Brain Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Anterior scalp block with 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml. may reduce the intraoperative opioid
      consumption in neurosurgical patients who undergoing the supratentorial craniotomy compared
      to those who receive 0.9% normal saline solution (placebo).

      A Prospective Randomized Double Blind Control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Patients who have supratentorial brain tumor

          2. Patients have been scheduled to undergo an elective craniotomy to remove tumor in any
             surgical position

          3. Patients have been general anesthetized with endotracheal intubation and control
             ventilation

          4. Patients who have provided consent for the participation in the research and for the
             use of their medical record in research

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Pregnant patients

          2. Patients who have a history of local anesthetic allergy and/ or anaphylaxis

intervention.description: Anterior scalp block will be done by using 0.5% plain Marcaine 20 ml.
Anterior scalp block will be done by using 0.9% normal saline 20 ml.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Pre-incisional Anterior Scalp Block on Intraoperative Opioid Consumption in Adult Patients Undergoing Elective Craniotomy to Remove Tumor: A Prospective Randomized Controlled

other_outcome.description: The rate of immediate extubation before transferring to the intensive care unit (ICU) compared between patients who received 0.5% plain Marcaine and 0.9% normal saline solution.
other_outcome.time_frame: end of surgery, before transferring to the intensive care unit

primary_outcome.description: The overall intravenous fentanyl consumption (microgram/ kilogram) during the surgery. The decision to administer fentanyl is guided by the changes of blood pressure and/ or heart rate greater than 20% from baseline level.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
The maximal systolic blood pressure within the first 5 minutes after skull pin insertion will be recorded.
The systolic blood pressure change from baseline will be calculated. The unit is mmHg.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after skull pin insertion

secondary_outcome.description:
The maximal heart rate within the first 5 minutes after skull pin insertion will be recorded.
The heart rate change from baseline level will be calculated. The unit is beats per minute.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 5 minutes after skull pin insertion

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
